data.name: Text0_01
data.value: First, we think that it would be important to determine what will be the structure I will follow during my essay as well as the questions which I would like to answer with it. Maybe, doing that it would be clearer and easier to understand my reflections.

data.name: Text0_02
data.value: What does innovation project management and evaluation mean? Is it important nowadays being implemented by companies?

data.name: Text0_03
data.value: What is the currently / nowadays the needs of innovation projects management and evaluation?

data.name: Text0_04
data.value: How can this IT tools help/improve/solve the needs? Any IT tools can solve these needs? What should be the characteristics of this IT to allow implement innovation projects?

data.name: Text0_05
data.value: If the companies using this IT tools in their innovation projects, can they obtain more benefits? I mean what is the final impact or benefit to the company for use this IT tools? Is it worth to spend the money or invest in it? Could any firm deal with price?

data.name: Text0_06
data.value: Why nowadays is very important to improve and have the best innovation projects management and evaluation? What would be the benefits?

data.name: Text0_07
data.value: As we have mentioned before, is important to keep in mind that innovation project management provide the tools, insight, and metrics need to successfully manage innovation project as well as helping readers identify problems in their organization, conceive elegant solutions, and, when necessary, promote changes to their organizational culture. Anyway, we should point out how relevant it can be for companies implement innovation projects, and for example, according to McKinsey, 84% of executives say that their future success is dependent on innovation, because it allows companies to stay competitive in the market. Basically, introducing something new (product, service) or transforming something to offer it different way will enable the company’s progress and growth. For do it, the firm will have to prepare the document in which proposing implementation methods of innovation activity programs, resulting in creation of new or significantly improved products, technologies, processes and services. Certainly, there have been many companies that have developed numerous innovation projects, which have brought them success, such as Google, Facebook or Amazon.

data.name: Text0_08
data.value: Even considering that one of the main characteristics of today's market is the massive competition, it is imperative to come up with innovative ideas to implement to obtain a new opportunity for expansion, either by offering something different to consumers or even the same product but in a new sector. The aim is to do something that was not done before. This leads to progress and development.

data.name: Text0_09
data.value: By the way, we are aware of is not the same innovation project than conventional project as well as its management is completely different. For example, one conventional project could be an expansion of the warehouse while as innovation project we can find the launch of new sugar free soft drink by one beverage companies. Besides, many of their differences could be the following:

data.name: Text0_10
data.value: Conventional projects should have clearly defined objectives. Innovation projects, usually, starts with weakly defined, sometimes ambiguous objectives, which become clearer in the following phases of project.

data.name: Text0_11
data.value: Project teams are comprised of people of different professions (knowledge and skills, etc.), among whom should exist high level of trust.

data.name: Text0_12
data.value: Considering the failure as a possible outcome, innovation project teams should with great concern take into consideration risk management.

data.name: Text0_13
data.value: The management of process conventional project is quicklier, easier, less risk to implement and develop than other about innovation project as well as the evaluation of them would be different. For instance, the company would be more carefully if it is evaluating its innovation project because the risk that it would be fail in the market or having one mistake is higher than others one. The point is the uncertainty of its success and its good adaptability in the market.

data.name: Text0_14
data.value: Therefore, they are different and for this reason they have different needs. Exactly, many of needs innovation project management could be:

data.name: Text0_15
data.value: Need to have creative and innovative ideas.

data.name: Text0_16
data.value: Need to maintain good, fluid, and open communication between team members to allow for the sharing and discussion of thoughts.

data.name: Text0_17
data.value: Need to prioritise ideas according to the mission, vision, values, principles, size, structure of the company and the market in which it operates.

data.name: Text0_18
data.value: Need to carry out an analysis of the expected consequences or results of the innovative project.

data.name: Text0_19
data.value: Need to set minimum objectives expected with the project (achieving a higher market share, a competitive advantage, capturing a new type of customer, idealising our consumers, 20% increase in sales for the year of the launch of the product in a new sector or of a new product in the same sector).

data.name: Text0_20
data.value: Need to study the probability of failure and minimise risk.

data.name: Text0_21
data.value: Need for a correct, detailed, and thorough post-launch or post-implementation evaluation of the project.

data.name: Text0_22
data.value: These needs are very specific and sensitive. In addition, is easy/logical to think that it is required a long time and detailed process since we had our creative or innovative ideas until we prioritize, compare between them as well as analyse, develop, implement, launch, evaluate them and, finally, achieve our expected objectives.

data.name: Text0_23
data.value: Thus, it would be necessary to have IT tools in advance with which to carry out this whole process in a faster, simpler, smoother, more fluid and safer way, mitigating the risk of failure. Also, as we can see in this picture, we are able to know three key digital transformation statistics very interesting about implementation of this new way to manage or carry out organizations and companies.

data.name: Text0_24
data.value: However, we know that not all innovative ideas or innovation projects are successful. There are many factors and variants that can affect the development of an innovation project, which must be considered by the company when structuring or managing its innovation project. Thus, to increase the probability of success, managers should previously analyse and study all the stages of the innovation process (opportunity identification, ideation & Idea management, concept development, development, testing and validating pilot service, launch) as well as carry out a correct evaluation of the same. It is not only important to get a good innovative idea, develop it and launch it. It is also necessary to analyse the post-launch, how it has been accepted by the sector or market in which it operates, if the results finally obtained are in line with those previously expected.

data.name: Text0_25
data.value: Thus, the management and evaluation of these innovative projects is not easy, nor is getting the idea that allows you to innovate. That is why technological and digital tools have been created to speed up the whole process and guarantee its success. Why technological tools? Easy and simple. We are in the digital and technological era, the information y electronic data is programmed, stored, and saved, and above all computerised in a secure cloud. Considering all the advantages that this entails, it was to be expected that the tool used to provide companies with a good management and evaluation of innovative projects would be technological. It’s been said that data is what powers industries worldwide. Nevertheless, few businesses (large or small) can remain competitive without the ability to collect data and turn it into useful information. IT provides the means to develop, process, analyse, exchange, store and secure it. That’s why is relevant to implement tools which would be specifically about information technology.

data.name: Text0_26
data.value: By the way, maybe to understand better how IT tools in general will be able to provide/support/manage/help/solve/cover/ensure the needs of innovation projects management and evaluation, it would be interesting to answer these main questions:

data.name: Text0_27
data.value: What are they like or how they are? What are their main characteristics and possible benefits to using them?

data.name: Text0_28
data.value: How can these tools support/cover/meet/satisfy/fulfil these needs?

data.name: Text0_29
data.value: Is any successful proof of that?

data.name: Text0_30
data.value: To answer the first question proposed information technology (IT) tools can provide the following two main advantages to any company:

data.name: Text0_31
data.value: Improve team unity. Consolidating IT tools also breaks down walls between various departments, makes collaborating easier and allows employees to make suggestions more efficiently. In addition, if the company doesn’t try improving this point, it’s likely that the business will operate less efficiently. Time is lost and projects delayed through a lack of communication and failure to engage key functions and stakeholders at the correct stage.

data.name: Text0_32
data.value: Increased productivity. Employees’ time can be put to better use if they can get their work done with a system that has everything, they need in one location. Therefore, saving time it will allow increase the efficiently as they can achieve their results/goals by putting the resources without wasting effort or energy. So, it will allow using and spending their saving time in other activities, skill, or ideas. Development is achieved in this way.

data.name: Text0_33
data.value: By the way, as we can see in the table, we can obtain more different types of benefits (Strategic, tactical, operational) for using information technology tools according with the report about

data.name: Text0_34
data.value: the benefits of IT tools in innovation process for SME sustainability.

data.name: Text0_35
data.value: So, information technology tools fosters innovation in business. Innovation results in smarter apps, improved data storage, faster processing, and wider information distribution. Innovation makes businesses run more efficiently. And innovation increases value, enhances quality, and boosts productivity. By the way, innovation through information technology has created the following radical changes in business:

data.name: Text0_36
data.value: Online shopping is more efficient than shopping in a store.

data.name: Text0_37
data.value: Social networking is more efficient than going to clubs.

data.name: Text0_38
data.value: Cloud computing is more efficient than a private computer network.

data.name: Text0_39
data.value: As you can see in this picture, there are many important metrics of measuring innovation in any organization as well as one of them most important is the sales growth. For this, it would be interesting that any company would try to implement new idea or thought, even if develop one that already exists adding something different to improve it.

data.name: Text0_40
data.value: Source: PwCs Innovation Benchmark

data.name: Text0_41
data.value: Therefore, we already know what the specific and special needs of innovation projects management and evaluation are as well as how the IT tools could be the best option to support them.

data.name: Text0_42
data.value: Anyway, not all tools are perfect, not every tool is suitable, it will depend on the type of company (size, market, industry, capital or equity, mission, vision, and values) and how much it is willing to innovate in its launches. Therefore, selecting an optimal tool is not easy, and requires a certain amount of risk-taking on the part of the company as it may fail, may not be efficient and effective, and may not deliver all the possible advantages and benefits that could be obtained if it is the perfect tool. In addition, errors and failures may occur during the process, and the project may not be successfully implemented. The company would not only have to assume the losses generated by the cost of managing the entire project, but also the cost of implementing the IT tool contracted.

data.name: Text0_43
data.value: So, we ask ourselves, have there been failure innovative projects even with the use of these tools? If there have been, here are some:

data.name: Text0_44
data.value: The Nintendo Virtual Boy

data.name: Text0_45
data.value: Colgate Lasagne

data.name: Text0_46
data.value: The McDonald’s McDLT

data.name: Text0_47
data.value: Google Glass

data.name: Text0_48
data.value: Apple iTunes

data.name: Text0_49
data.value: In fact, not only famous companies can obtain these failures, because studies show that around 60% to 80% of company’s innovations fail and the main reason for it can be the following:

data.name: Text0_50
data.value: Wrong decisions

data.name: Text0_51
data.value: Low priority for innovation

data.name: Text0_52
data.value: Lack of market orientation

data.name: Text0_53
data.value: Slow structures

data.name: Text0_54
data.value: Therefore, it’s essential for companies to implement a good evaluation model and strategy for the management of the innovative project to determine its success. As we have already seen in class, there are different evaluation models (scorecard), which serve as support and help for the management of innovation.

data.name: Text0_55
data.value: Therefore, it is not only important to make use of the technological tools to correctly carry out each stage of the innovation process, but also the evaluation model will be vital, as it can allow restructuring, changes, and modifications to avoid as much as possible the failure of the project to be launched. However, the risk or probability of failure will depend on whether it is a radical innovation or not. If it is a radical innovation, knowing that the risk is greater, but the probability of remaining in the market if it is carried out correctly will be high.

data.name: Text0_56
data.value: Perhaps it would be a good option if the company will try to use their IT tools to reduce and minimize these mistakes, but for do it, previously they should find adequate, appropriate, and correct tool for them. For example, the most popular or famous of them are the following:

data.name: Text0_57
data.value: Obviously, there some differences between them, and the company could choice/select one according to their conditions, structure, objectives. For example, if the company specially need to implement one of this IT tools because it would like to have more creative ideas easily, maybe it the best option would be using the last one explains in the table (Inno360) because it allows search for opportunities and ideas on its own web.

data.name: Text0_58
data.value: Many companies. Many markets. Competitiveness. Need to be different, to offer something new, not better than the rest, but new. Adapt or die.

data.name: Text0_59
data.value: Need for creative and innovative ideas to implement. Thousands of opportunities to experiment, analyse, develop, and exploit. The value of ideas is more important than ever. They can be turned into success if each stage of the innovation process is done correctly.

data.name: Text0_60
data.value: It is not an easy, quick, and free process. Uncertainty, risk and insecurity. It certainly requires commitment, willingness, effort, organisation and patience.

data.name: Text0_61
data.value: Digital and technological era. Codification, processing, recording, storage and access to information and data in the same place with a single click. Facilities to take advantage of. IT Tools to learn to use.

data.name: Text0_62
data.value: Innovation is possible, success is achievable. The tools exist. It is only a question of analysing, studying, and choosing the right one.

data.name: Text0_63
data.value: Now more than ever.

data.name: Title
data.value: Innovative initiative evaluation
